intro: Guettarda antirhoea, commonly known as the red-stemmed guettarda, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas and disturbed soils. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in warm regions.
